context.p: Since most Linux distributions have dnsmasq" or bind or another DNS server running on the same physical host as the CLC, DNS in Eucalyptus is disabled by default. You can enable DNS after disabling or re-configuring any other services that listen on port 53.

step.cmd: Log in the CLC and open the /etc/eucalyptus/eucalyptus.conf file.
Edit the value of DISABLE_DNS to N:
Verify that the DNS service is running:

info.p: Look for 53. Port 53 should be bound by the process eucalyptus-cloud.

taskbody.postreq: You are now ready to configure the DNS.
